text: I found this place by mistake and I'm so glad I did. It's such a cute restaurant and perfect if your not in the mood for a big meal. My friend and I went and had a great experience. The food was great and the service was really nice. Very chill place.
Two main reasons: Off Season Paczkis Nutella Paczkis Also, great Pierogi selection! Definitely going back to try different parts of their menu. ...and more paczkis.

Tried pierogis out of their food truck. I didn't like a single thing. I really don't get the hype.  I paid $11 for 2 potato and cheese, 2 braised beef, and 2 spinach pierogis, and a sausage on the side. I got all the toppings they offered except sour cream but that still couldn't save the meal for me.  The food was cold which I won't hold against them but it could be impacting the flavor. The pierogis just didn't taste savory and all the stuffing had about the same consistency. How is it that potato and cheese, and braised beef, and spinach all look the same consistency wise ?  If I get an empanada and take a bite, I will see strips of chicken and actual chunks of potato. The insides for all of them just looked like compacted mush. I wish I had taken a picture to better explain myself but really I took two bites and threw all my food away.

Had sauerkraut and potato cheese pierogi-very good. Sauerkraut side, was done perfectly. Polish sausage was generous portion and tasted great. Got a raspberry paczki  to go, and it was good until I noticed something odd on the bottom, looked green/mold like so not sure if moisture got to it underneath.  If I had been in the store, I would have told them, of course, but I took the paczki to go. Regardless, because of the good service and quality of the other items,  I would go back and try other items on the menu as well!  Parking was a bit of a challenge with the road construction on California, but that will likely be finished soon!.  I am willing to go  back and try again, even with the paczki issue.  I

Had a snack size of the Potato and cheese pierogi today at Daley Plaza from the Pierogi food truck.  I love a good Pierogi and was really hoping this would be, unfortunately it just wasn't great, just good.  They were lukewarm and although a great size and topped with free toppings, I chose sour cream and bacon, the bacon saved these since the inside of the perogi was a little on the dry side.  I'm hoping it was just an off day for this truck and wouldn't hold it against the brick and mortar location but just can't rave about these Pierogi's :(

Crispy perogi... Yum. My favorite flavor is the spinach. I love how they allow you to mix and match. An order comes with two sides. Not a big fan of their kraut. Menu is minimal without being sparse.  Great service: order up front and take a seat. The server even returned to ask if there's anything else needed. The pretzels looked delish. Cool interior. Love the neutral colored murals.

I actually went to their food truck at the Bucktown Arts Festival on Saturday. At the food truck you can get 4, 7 or 9 pierogis for different price points. Since I just needed a snack I got the 4 for $7.  They were offering two meat based and two vegetarian options. My friend got the spinach and cheese while I got the braised beef. You have your option of toppings so I got the sauerkraut and my friend had the spicy sautéed onions.  Both were really delicious. The onions were indeed spicy but added great flavor to the pierogi. The sauerkraut I got had flax and cumin seeds in it, and wasn't over powering with vinegar. The beef was nice and juicy and had the right mix of seasoning. With a bit of sour cream for each of us we had the right combination. I would love to eat here again and try different toppings. They gave a coupon to their store so I'm hoping to come back and give it a try.
Went there for the first time for the Sunday brunch.  Excellent food along with great service.  Would recommend to anyone looking for great Eastern European food in the Humboldt Park neighborhood!

I live really close to this place and I love it! You really can't go wrong when picking a perogi, or an open faced sandwich. They have a lot of seating and very quick service, and the staff has always been attentive. My favorite perogis are probably the spinach and mushroom ones.

A good friend introduced me to Polish food a few years ago. I have tried many places and I was not satisfied. As a treat I decided to take my family to this restaurant. We ordered two platters of assorted pierogi, a sausage sandwich and an extra sausage with a side of pickles. Our order came with an assortment of toppings. Our waiter was extremely kind and attentive to our needs. I tried their lemonade and it was delicious. My daughter decided to do a lemonade/ice tea mix and she said it taste great. I will be back one night without the children because this place is BYOB.

Very good.  I had each of the five pierogi offered with all of the sides. Though the spinach was my favorite, they were all very tasty. I also had an oatmeal and chocolate chip cookie and Cheerwine. I'll be back.
This is the first yelp review I have ever given. Even though I love yelp. I can't understand why more people don't go to this place. BYOB. Amazing food. Good prices. Nice atmosphere. It's great!

Sorry grandma, Pierogi Street makes the best Polish food ever! Just had one of every Pierogi and the Polish sausage. This is not the all you can eat stuff. Very tasty. The staff who I believe are the owners are very friendly. Nice place all around. Don't let construction on California scare you away, this place is worth a visit.
Honestly these are the best damn pierogi I've ever had. 12$ for 6 mix pierogi with all toppings and a polish sausage! So freaking good man. Try this spot out!

Yum!   I went with the "one of each plus a polish sausage" meal option and looooved it.  It's about the right amount of food for a lunch for one.  I wasn't a huge fan of the sauerkraut pierogi, but I think that's just my taste buds- my friend liked hers.  Surprisingly large selection for vegetarians.  Cute decor.  Friendly staff.   I'll be back to try out the other menu options.

I liked the perogies, they were very tasty. I tried the "Hungry" portion, 8 for $11. I really enjoyed them, my only complaint, they were $11, make it 10 or 11 perogies for the same price. Otherwise, mighty nice place in the neighborhood.
The food is great.....just really expensive.  Its a peirogi!

Food truck turned b&m.  Food: stupid good. Simple and done so well it warms my soul. Beef is the star pierogi  Decor: supper food trucks hipster style. Think it fits perfectly. People: so very nice and helpful. Seemed to really love what she does.  Byob I think

This place is amazing and consistently delicious. I've tried nearly everything on the menu and have yet to be disappointed. They also have a great selection of paczkis and baked goods.  In general, it's a super cute place and a great addition to the Humboldt Park neighborhood.  My only negative experience thus far has been going to grab a snack at 2:30 (they close at 3PM) and was told that they were only offering takeout. I am a paying customer and wanted to sit down and eat and came in during their posted hours only to be told that I have to take my food to go. It was just tacky. They should adjust their hours if they don't want to have people in the restaurant past a certain time. Really unprofessional.

It has been a great pleasure to watch Damien and his colleagues build this wonderful business from nothing except determination and an unflagging commitment to quality.  I enjoy the food regularly from the wagon and have been to the restaurant a couple of times.  The pierogis are the best, and I have real Polish people to vouch for them.  The peppery caramel used onions that garnish the pierogis show that attention to detail, it takes lots of time and careful preparation to get onions THAT good. The meat pierogi also deserve special attention--not just boring ground meat, but flavorful pot roast cooked until totally tender.  Looking for a unique food to bring to a potluck? I recommend getting in touch with Pierogi Street. You will be a hit!

Not only the best pierogi and polish food I've ever had (and I loved Kiev in NYC so many years ago), but this may have been the best family brunch experience I've had since moving to Chicago! Lovely staff, amazing food, simple and welcoming environment. My kids loved everything about it too! We sampled and shared everything, including some dessert pastries, and loved it all! I can see we'll be back again and again!

I love supporting delicious locally owned restaurants like this one! But as for Earth's standards... Positives: The Polak Eatery serves their food on washable, reusable dishes with silverware.  Negatives: They forgot about washable mugs and cups! The Polak Eatery serves drinks in plastic, disposable cups with tops and straws and their coffee in wax paper cups.   Please continue your good practices by serving drinks in washable cups, talk about unnecessary waste! Additionally: In response to Barbara T.'s note that stated: "Referring to a POLISH restaurant as POLACK is really tacky. I would take my coffee in the paper cup before I would insult a nationality." This restaurant was called the 'Polak Eatery' before they changed it to 'Pierogi Street'. If you feel strongly about it, please contact Pierogi Street Directly. I am just interested in positively effecting the environment. Thanks!

Was excited to try this one out but regretfully it's the same old pierogies/Polish food. When will Chicago open up a gourmet Polish restaurant? Also what's up with the name POLAK?. It might mean "Polish person" in Polish - but has a very negative meaning in the U.S.!

I was excited to come here, having been raised in a polish family and missing the homemade pierogis I grew up on. The soup was warm and comforting and the pierogi were prepared right, making up for the lack of authentic fillings but the spicy onions reminded me of dinner at my grandma's house. The space is adorable but it was so cold that I had to eat with my coat on and it was one of the warmer days we've had lately. As a result, my food was quickly cold as well, the side sausage was barely room temperature. I wish I could say I'd be back but polish cuisine is cold weather food and I'd rather not enjoy it actually IN the cold.

As soon as I found out there was a new place in Chicago that sold pierogies near me, I immediately added it to my list of places to try.  The Polak Eatery did not disappoint! I wasn't particularly hungry when I went in, so my boyfriend and I split the 6 mix-and-match, getting 3 cheddar potatoes, then one of each of the other kind.  While I didn't try the meat one, the other 3 were all delicious.  The best part is: they come with all the fixins-- sour cream, spicy grilled onions, bacon, and sauerkraut...at no added charge! The only real complaint I had was the size.  These are some small little nuggets of goodness...two bites and they're gone.  I easily could've eaten an order of 6 by myself, since we didn't order sandwiches. They also serve keilbasa (after 10 years of not eating meat, this is the one thing I still crave) as well as a few other sandwich options, if pierogies alone won't tide you over.  But the real motivation for coming in this particular weekend was the paczkis.  They weren't the best I've ever had (not enough jelly...although can there ever really be enough jelly?!) but they hit the spot.   The restaurant itself is really cute and not hard to get to at all if you're in Humboldt or Wicker Park.  I'm definitely looking forward to coming back here and taking my family next time they're in town. But let me state for the record: While these pierogies may be really freaking good, none will ever be better than my mom's. But she lives in Ohio and does not own a restaurant, so Polak Eatery may just be your best option...unless you come to my house on Christmas.

Have been here multiple times for breakfast.  We have always enjoyed the pierogis and I have recently started ordering the grilled cheese which is fantastic.  Love the food and the friendly staff.  This is a great addition to the neighborhood.
The food is amazing I was speechless how good the food was. Come try this place out and recommend it to all your friends.

We're in for a cold winter, if November is any indication. The good news is you now have the perfect winter meal courtesy of the Polak Eatery. These pierogis, and an accompanying sausage, will bring a smile to your face and warm your tummy. Delish! More please!
Amazing! Best pierogi branch in Chicago. Ask for the spinach or meat pierogies. Very good!

I love this place. This neighborhood needed a casual spot to grab a quick bite and this place more than fits the bill. The food is simple but really tasty. The staff doesn't make you feel dumb if you don't know what a pierogi or kielbasa is. It's clean and they serve food on real plates with real silverware. I'm quickly becoming a regular!
Cool space, super-friendly staff, and excellent pierogi selection (with all the free toppings you want!)

I'm super happy this gem opened up in my hood. Need more great places like this. The pierogis were delicious, service fast and great ambiance. Please don't let this place leave us. Go eat here!!! $6 pierogi breakfast plate? Yes brunch please! We had 12 pierogis (4 of each flavor - cheddar, beef, and mushroom/sauerkraut) and a sausage. $20 for a fast delicious dinner for 2!

I came cross Polak Eatery via Yelp and figured this place was worth trying out. I'm so glad my boyfriend and I did. We went in late Sunday morning for a "mini-brunch." We weren't starving, but wanted a little nosh to hold through for a late lunch ahead. We decided to order four pierogies ($6) and a breakfast plate (two eggs, piece of kielbasa, two pierogies) ($6). For the pierogies, they allow you to mix and match flavors (braised beef, cheddar potato, spinach & ricotta, kraut & mushroom) and you can choose from a variety of fixings such as sour cream, caramelized onions, sauerkraut, and bacon (thankfully it comes with!).  We ordered the cheddar potato and braised beef pierogies. The cheddar potato was perfect because it wasn't overly cheesy or salty. Flavor wise, I liked the braised beef, but it was slightly drier than I had hoped. It wasn't bad enough to warrant a lower rating. The pierogies were nicely prepared -- much better than those frozen ones I used to buy as a child from aisle 3 in the supermarket. Many cultures have a version of a dumpling, but these most reminded me of Chinese potstickers. Slightly crispy or firm on the outside and very moist and soft in the inside. The toppings all work whether individually or all together. They're not random; they show that thought was put into this. The sunny-side up eggs were nicely cooked; runny yolks are always a joy to eat. The kielbasa was tasty and I think it was pan-fried because it had a good crunch outside. Polak Eatery's decor is minimal. There is a mural presumably of Poland's landscape in fifty shades of gray (not the book, but the color). There is plenty of room to move around, but with limited seating. Having said that, I think they could probably squeeze in a couple more tables and chairs. So far, since the business is new, it was full, but not packed. Most lovely was the fact that the business owner, Damien, came by to greet my boyfriend and me as we ate. It always helps to have the owner come out and greet customers. That's how a small business is run. Overall, I recommend this spot. Hearty food, but not anything to make you feel regretful.

Amazing!  Stopped for breakfast and was exactly what we were looking for-perfect blend of bold and interesting flavors without being too obtrusive.  Great coffee and service as well.  We will bring making this a regular spot.

Suuuuuper happy this cafe opened up! love the ambiance, the friendly staff, the fresh intelligentsia coffee...and mosf of all **drumroll** THE PIEROGIES are on-point! i tried the caramelized onion & mushroom, Potato & cheddar, spinach & feta. All delicious and a must have, i was never a big pierogi person, but was so delightfully surprised by the goodness of theirs. They mentioned adding on more items on the menu so im looking fwd to that. Picked up the giant cookie was great too. Love it! Good vibes all around!

So never got to catch the truck. I was excited to see them open a bricks and mortar location right here in Humboldt Park. Went over to get some breakfast and found a clean, (important) modern little cafe that I was very impressed with. Got to speak with one of the owners and loved the enthusiasm and committement to the community. I always like to support new business and especially for young first timers working to better themselves and their community. The food was great! Had the eggs cheese and potato pierogi and a sausage all for $6, can't beat that! Also got an order of the other pierogi offerings and loved each of them. Generous amount of bacon and onions and nice fresh pierogi. I'm sure with customer input and experience the Polak Eatery will only improve and be a regular spot for the neighbors.
Delicious pillows of goodness , the variety is enjoyable , the atmosphere is cozy and welcoming ,hurry to enjoy ....... Just delightful

Ok I'm a Ukie "Ukrainian" and have been eating Pierogies as long as I could remember I was never a fan of Meat Pierogies Homemade or else where. Until I had them on the Pierogi Wagon. (Most meat Pierogies that I tried. have a Liver flavor / Iron Flavor.) But not these they are some of the best I have ever had.  The sauerkraut and mushrooms are also very good. as with everything else on the menu. I have been a fan of Pierogi Wagon for some time now. and now that theirs a restaurant. I will stop by as much as possible and will recommend as many friends to try this place. If you want some Authentic Polish food you have to stop by here and have a plate I can't wait to see what else will be added to the menu. Some nice simple Polish Chicken Noodle Soup will be nice on a cold day. I would like to see some Chamomile Tea on the menu but that is no big deal and a easy fix. This place will fill you up and satisfy your taste Buds.

I can't seem to find myself in the right place at the right time to experience Pierogi Wagon, so when I heard the same people were opening a brick and mortar location, I was super excited. Yes, I'm Polish, and grew up between Chicago and Poland, so I'm pretty well versed in the pierogi and kielbasa arena. I dragged my friends to the grand opening as a pit-stop before our drive to the North Shore. When we arrived I learned that neither of them had ever had pierogi before - unacceptable when you live in Chicago!  It was around 10:30 am. I ordered the breakfast entree with a couple pierogi, eggs, and polish sausage. Everything was delicious and my friends thoroughly enjoyed their meal but the sausage (!) was really phenomenal. I almost ordered another.  The walls lack decor but I'm sure that will change in the coming weeks. Lots of reclaimed wood, grays and warm neutral colors make this place modern, welcoming, and pleasant. Service was above average, so no complaints there. Everyone was super helpful in explaining the relatively simple menu.  The icing on top of the cake was that the coffee was really good. Cheap prices, delicious food, great atmosphere, and exceptional staff will drive Polak Eatery to success.

WOW!!! Never been a pierogi person at all, but was next door at Humboldt House and starving and thought, "ehh what the heck". The place looks really cool! Walked in and ordered one of each pierogi and all the toppings as well. It arrived at our table moments later and MAN were they good! As I am eating, some really sweet polish women in the corner offer me some wine-- it turns out today is the grand opening! This place is a really cool concept developed by the guys behind perogi wagon. These perogis are delicious!! Hands down the best perogis I have ever had, not to mention they have great polish sausage as well. I went back and ordered another round of perogis and threw a sausage on the order this time. Good choice, Alexis, good choice. Anyways this place is fantastic the guys are so nice and the food is amazing. What a great addition to Humboldt! Welcome to the neighborhood guys!!
